page.title: 17CHANGES IN CAISTOR SCHOOLS 2
page.content: Opinion (see page 16)became polarised into two 'camps';one group supporting the creation of a{comprehensive school(which had the backing of the local Labour Party);the other preferring the retention of a selective{grammar school}and therefore supporting the 'closer cooperation' option.Leaflets from both campaigns were distributed door to door, letters were written to the Education Committee, councillers and Members of Parliament. The Education Committee eventually decided to retain the selective grammar school(the Caistor area is one of the few areas in the country to have selective education),but with closer cooperation with the Caistor Yarborough Secondary Modern.This scheme to be implemented by Sept.1986.
